alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 11:10AM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Babcock affecting Wood County. Wolf River at New London affecting Winnebago, Outagamie and Waupaca Counties. Wisconsin River below Wausau affecting Marathon County. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Peshtigo River near Porterfield affecting Marinette County. Wolf River near Shiocton affecting Shawano, Outagamie and Waupaca Counties. For the Yellow River...including Babcock...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Pembine, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lower Wolf River...including Shiocton, New London, Lake Poygan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Peshtigo River near Porterfield. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Area boat docks begin flooding and there is widespread flooding of wooded lowland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Thursday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
